intro: Sieruela micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered sieruela, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Sieruela micrantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
